An issue was discovered in the CommentBox extension for MediaWiki
through 1.35.2. Via crafted configuration variables, a malicious actor
could introduce XSS payloads into various layers.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31551
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/q/I20b63bd38779d2ccbe2d86f9879df85ca3b685f6
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/q/I5e0abbc2f80e6bda255b3b32a4df39a7fe7d3793
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/q/Ibe68b070ee791cd0c8e7f50eb04ac4e066b1512c
Reference: MISC:https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T259433

An issue was discovered in the PageForms extension for MediaWiki
through 1.35.2. Crafted payloads for Token-related query parameters
allowed for XSS on certain PageForms-managed MediaWiki pages.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31552
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/q/I8bae477ad7e4d0190335363ac2decf28e4313da1
Reference: MISC:https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T152394

An issue was discovered in the AbuseFilter extension for MediaWiki
through 1.35.2. It incorrectly executed certain rules related to
blocking accounts after account creation. Such rules would allow for
user accounts to be created while blocking only the IP address used to
create an account (and not the user account itself). Such rules could
also be used by a nefarious, unprivileged user to catalog and
enumerate any number of IP addresses related to these account
creations.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31553
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/extensions/CheckUser/+/666963
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/extensions/CheckUser/+/666964
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/extensions/CheckUser/+/667023
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/extensions/CheckUser/+/667024
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/extensions/CheckUser/+/667025
Reference: MISC:https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/extensions/CheckUser/+/667027
Reference: MISC:https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T275669

An issue was discovered in the CheckUser extension for MediaWiki
through 1.35.2. MediaWiki usernames with trailing whitespace could be
stored in the cu_log database table such that denial of service
occurred for certain CheckUser extension pages and functionality. For
example, the attacker could turn off Special:CheckUserLog and thus
interfere with usage tracking.

through 1.35.2. It improperly handled account blocks for certain
automatically created MediaWiki user accounts, thus allowing nefarious
users to remain unblocked.

arbitrary events to an index in Splunk Enterprise Indexer 8.1 versions
before 8.1.5 and 8.2 versions before 8.2.1. The vulnerability impacts
Indexers configured to use TCPTokens. It does not impact Universal
Forwarders.

Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20240130 Re: CVE-2023-6246: Heap-based buffer overflow in the glibc's syslog()
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/01/30/8

Sudo before 1.9.5p2 contains an off-by-one error that can result in a
heap-based buffer overflow, which allows privilege escalation to root
via "sudoedit -s" and a command-line argument that ends with a single
backslash character.

Name: CVE-2021-31562

Reference: MISC:https://www.cisa.gov/uscert/ics/advisories/icsma-21-355-01
Reference: URL:https://www.cisa.gov/uscert/ics/advisories/icsma-21-355-01

The SSL/TLS configuration of Fresenius Kabi Agilia Link + version 3.0
has serious deficiencies that may allow an attacker to compromise
SSL/TLS sessions in different ways. An attacker may be able to
eavesdrop on transferred data, manipulate data allegedly secured by
SSL/TLS, and impersonate an entity to gain access to sensitive
information.

Name: CVE-2021-31566
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-31566
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-31566
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2024237
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2024237
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/libarchive/libarchive/commit/b41daecb5ccb4c8e3b2c53fd6147109fc12c3043
Reference: URL:https://github.com/libarchive/libarchive/commit/b41daecb5ccb4c8e3b2c53fd6147109fc12c3043
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/libarchive/libarchive/issues/1566
Reference: URL:https://github.com/libarchive/libarchive/issues/1566
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20221122 [SECURITY] [DLA 3202-1] libarchive security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/11/msg00030.html

An improper link resolution flaw can occur while extracting an archive
leading to changing modes, times, access control lists, and flags of a
file outside of the archive. An attacker may provide a malicious
archive to a victim user, who would trigger this flaw when trying to
extract the archive. A local attacker may use this flaw to gain more
privileges in a system.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31567
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/WPChill/download-monitor/blob/master/changelog.txt
Reference: URL:https://github.com/WPChill/download-monitor/blob/master/changelog.txt
Reference: CONFIRM:https://patchstack.com/database/vulnerability/download-monitor/wordpress-download-monitor-plugin-4-4-6-authenticated-arbitrary-file-download-vulnerability
Reference: URL:https://patchstack.com/database/vulnerability/download-monitor/wordpress-download-monitor-plugin-4-4-6-authenticated-arbitrary-file-download-vulnerability
Reference: CONFIRM:https://wordpress.org/plugins/download-monitor/#developers
Reference: URL:https://wordpress.org/plugins/download-monitor/#developers

Authenticated (admin+) Arbitrary File Download vulnerability
discovered in Download Monitor WordPress plugin (versions <= 4.4.6).
The plugin allows arbitrary files, including sensitive configuration
files such as wp-config.php, to be downloaded via the
&downloadable_file_urls[0] parameter data. It's also possible to
escape from the web server home directory and download any file within
the OS.

Name: CVE-2021-31576
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://corp.mediatek.com/product-security-acknowledgements
Reference: URL:https://corp.mediatek.com/product-security-acknowledgements

In Boa, there is a possible information disclosure due to a missing
permission check. This could lead to remote information disclosure to
a proximal attacker with no additional execution privileges needed.
User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Patch ID: A20210008;
Issue ID: OSBNB00123241.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31579
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2021/06/08/akkadian-provisioning-manager-multiple-vulnerabilities-disclosure/
Reference: URL:https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2021/06/08/akkadian-provisioning-manager-multiple-vulnerabilities-disclosure/

Akkadian Provisioning Manager Engine (PME) ships with a hard-coded
credential, akkadianuser:haakkadianpassword. This issue was resolved
in Akkadian OVA appliance version 3.0 (and later), Akkadian
Provisioning Manager 5.0.2 (and later), and Akkadian Appliance Manager
3.3.0.314-4a349e0 (and later).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31580
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2021/06/08/akkadian-provisioning-manager-multiple-vulnerabilities-disclosure/
Reference: URL:https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2021/06/08/akkadian-provisioning-manager-multiple-vulnerabilities-disclosure/

The restricted shell provided by Akkadian Provisioning Manager Engine
(PME) can be bypassed by switching the OpenSSH channel from `shell` to
`exec` and providing the ssh client a single execution parameter. This
issue was resolved in Akkadian OVA appliance version 3.0 (and later),
Akkadian Provisioning Manager 5.0.2 (and later), and Akkadian
Appliance Manager 3.3.0.314-4a349e0 (and later).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31581
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2021/06/08/akkadian-provisioning-manager-multiple-vulnerabilities-disclosure/
Reference: URL:https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2021/06/08/akkadian-provisioning-manager-multiple-vulnerabilities-disclosure/

The restricted shell provided by Akkadian Provisioning Manager Engine
(PME) can be escaped by abusing the 'Edit MySQL Configuration'
command. This command launches a standard vi editor interface which
can then be escaped. This issue was resolved in Akkadian OVA appliance
version 3.0 (and later), Akkadian Provisioning Manager 5.0.2 (and
later), and Akkadian Appliance Manager 3.3.0.314-4a349e0 (and later).

Name: CVE-2021-31583
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://lists.sipwise.com/pipermail/spce-user_lists.sipwise.com/2021-September/014708.html

user: Stored XSS in callforward/time/set/save (POST tsetname);
Reflected XSS in addressbook (GET filter); Stored XSS in
addressbook/save (POST firstname, lastname, company); and Reflected
XSS in statistics/versions (GET lang).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31590
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pwndoc/pwndoc/blob/59519735b0d831d8fd96d7c3387f66d28407e583/CHANGELOG.md#040-2021-08-23
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pwndoc/pwndoc/commit/15f3dc0e212eda465e05fda0feb002d1bce2939d
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pwndoc/pwndoc/commit/ff1b868cec55f5b6c7a91e15a2b0b1f4324121ab
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pwndoc/pwndoc/pull/128
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pwndoc/pwndoc/pull/74
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pwndoc/pwndoc/security/advisories
Reference: MISC:https://www.dgc.org/responsible_disclosure_pwndoc_jwt

PwnDoc all versions until 0.4.0 (2021-08-23) has incorrect JSON
Webtoken handling, leading to incorrect access control. With a valid
JSON Webtoken that is used for authentication and authorization, a
user can keep his admin privileges even if he is downgraded to the
"user" privilege. Even after a user's account is deleted, the user can
still access the administration panel (and add or delete users) and
has complete access to the system.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31597
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210618-0004/
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/mjwwit/node-XMLHttpRequest/commit/bf53329b61ca6afc5d28f6b8d2dc2e3ca740a9b2
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/mjwwit/node-XMLHttpRequest/compare/v1.6.0...1.6.1
Reference: MISC:https://people.kingsds.network/wesgarland/xmlhttprequest-ssl-vuln.txt

The xmlhttprequest-ssl package before 1.6.1 for Node.js disables SSL
certificate validation by default, because rejectUnauthorized (when
the property exists but is undefined) is considered to be false within
the https.request function of Node.js. In other words, no certificate
is ever rejected.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31598
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://sourceforge.net/p/ezxml/bugs/28/
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20210708 [SECURITY] [DLA 2705-1] scilab security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/07/msg00005.html

An issue was discovered in libezxml.a in ezXML 0.8.6. The function
ezxml_decode() performs incorrect memory handling while parsing
crafted XML files, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow.

Name: CVE-2021-31599

Pentaho Business Intelligence Server through 7.x. A reports (.prpt)
file allows the inclusion of BeanShell scripts to ease the production
of complex reports. An authenticated user can run arbitrary code.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-3160
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.aca.fr/solution/assurex-solution-gestion-des-contrats-assurance/
Reference: MISC:https://www.digital.security/fr/sites/default/files/advisories/cert-ds_advisory_cve-2021-3160.txt

Deserialization of untrusted data in the login page of ASSUWEB 359.3
build 1 subcomponent of ACA ASSUREX RENTES product allows a remote
attacker to inject unsecure serialized Java object using a specially
crafted HTTP request, resulting in an unauthenticated remote code
execution on the server.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31600
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/164787/Pentaho-Business-Analytics-Pentaho-Business-Server-9.1-User-Enumeration.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.hitachi.com/hirt/security/index.html

An issue was discovered in Hitachi Vantara Pentaho through 9.1 and
Pentaho Business Intelligence Server through 7.x. They implement a
series of web services using the SOAP protocol to allow scripting
interaction with the backend server. An authenticated user (regardless
of privileges) can list all valid usernames.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31601
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/164779/Pentaho-Business-Analytics-Pentaho-Business-Server-9.1-Insufficient-Access-Control.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.hitachi.com/hirt/security/index.html

An issue was discovered in Hitachi Vantara Pentaho through 9.1 and
Pentaho Business Intelligence Server through 7.x. They implement a
series of web services using the SOAP protocol to allow scripting
interaction with the backend server. An authenticated user (regardless
of privileges) can list all databases connection details and
credentials.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31602
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/164784/Pentaho-Business-Analytics-Pentaho-Business-Server-9.1-Authentication-Bypass.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.hitachi.com/hirt/security/index.html

An issue was discovered in Hitachi Vantara Pentaho through 9.1 and
Pentaho Business Intelligence Server through 7.x. The Security Model
has different layers of Access Control. One of these layers is the
applicationContext security, which is defined in the
applicationContext-spring-security.xml file. The default configuration
allows an unauthenticated user with no previous knowledge of the
platform settings to extract pieces of information without possessing
valid credentials.

Name: CVE-2021-31607
Status: Candidate
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-5011

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-00ada7e667

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-158e9c6eb9
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6BUWUF5VTENNP2ZYZBVFKPSUHLKLUBD5/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-5aaebdae8e

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-93a7c8b7c6
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ACVT7M4YLZRLWWQ6SGRK3C6TOF4FXOXT/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202310-22
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202310-22
Reference: MISC:https://sec.stealthcopter.com/saltstack-snapper-minion-privledge-escaltion/
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20211110 [SECURITY] [DLA 2815-1] salt security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/11/msg00009.html

In SaltStack Salt 2016.9 through 3002.6, a command injection
vulnerability exists in the snapper module that allows for local
privilege escalation on a minion. The attack requires that a file is
created with a pathname that is backed up by snapper, and that the
master calls the snapper.diff function (which executes popen
unsafely).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31609
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/general/braktooth.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://www.silabs.com/wireless/bluetooth/bluegiga-classic-legacy-modules/device.wt32i-a

The Bluetooth Classic implementation in Silicon Labs iWRAP 6.3.0 and
earlier does not properly handle the reception of an oversized LMP
packet greater than 17 bytes, allowing attackers in radio range to
trigger a crash in WT32i via a crafted LMP packet.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31610
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.bluetrum.com/product/ab5376t.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.bluetrum.com/product/bt8896a.html
Reference: MISC:https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/general/braktooth.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://www.mi.com/global/mi-true-wireless-earbuds-basic-2/

The Bluetooth Classic implementation on AB32VG1 devices does not
properly handle the reception of continuous unsolicited LMP responses,
allowing attackers in radio range to trigger a denial of service
(either restart or deadlock the device) by flooding a device with
LMP_AU_rand data.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31611
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.zh-jieli.com/product/68-cn.html
Reference: MISC:https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/general/braktooth.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://launchstudio.bluetooth.com/ListingDetails/19746
Reference: MISC:https://launchstudio.bluetooth.com/ListingDetails/58628

The Bluetooth Classic implementation on Zhuhai Jieli AC690X and AC692X
devices does not properly handle an out-of-order LMP Setup procedure
that is followed by a malformed LMP packet, allowing attackers in
radio range to deadlock a device via a crafted LMP packet. The user
needs to manually reboot the device to restore communication.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31612
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.zh-jieli.com/product/68-cn.html
Reference: MISC:https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/general/braktooth.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://launchstudio.bluetooth.com/ListingDetails/19746

The Bluetooth Classic implementation on Zhuhai Jieli AC690X devices
does not properly handle the reception of an oversized LMP packet
greater than 17 bytes during the LMP auto rate procedure, allowing
attackers in radio range to trigger a deadlock via a crafted LMP
packet.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31613
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.zh-jieli.com/product/68-cn.html
Reference: MISC:https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/general/braktooth.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://launchstudio.bluetooth.com/ListingDetails/19746
Reference: MISC:https://launchstudio.bluetooth.com/ListingDetails/58628

The Bluetooth Classic implementation on Zhuhai Jieli AC690X and AC692X
devices does not properly handle the reception of a truncated LMP
packet during the LMP auto rate procedure, allowing attackers in radio
range to immediately crash (and restart) a device via a crafted LMP
packet.

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31615
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bluetooth.com
Reference: MISC:https://www.bluetooth.com/learn-about-bluetooth/key-attributes/bluetooth-security/injectable/

Unencrypted Bluetooth Low Energy baseband links in Bluetooth Core
Specifications 4.0 through 5.2 may permit an adjacent device to inject
a crafted packet during the receive window of the listening device
before the transmitting device initiates its packet transmission to
achieve full MITM status without terminating the link. When applied
against devices establishing or using encrypted links, crafted packets
may be used to terminate an existing link, but will not compromise the
confidentiality or integrity of the link.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31616
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://blog.inhq.net/posts/keepkey-CVE-2021-31616/
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/keepkey/keepkey-firmware/commit/e49d45594002d4d3fbc1f03488e6dfc0a0a65836
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/keepkey/keepkey-firmware/releases/tag/v7.1.0
Reference: MISC:https://shapeshift.com/library/keepkey-important-update-issued-april-4-required

Insufficient length checks in the ShapeShift KeepKey hardware wallet
firmware before 7.1.0 allow a stack buffer overflow via crafted
messages. The overflow in ethereum_extractThorchainSwapData() in
ethereum.c can circumvent stack protections and lead to code
execution. The vulnerable interface is reachable remotely over WebUSB.

Name: CVE-2021-31617
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://advisories.stormshield.eu/
Reference: MISC:https://advisories.stormshield.eu/2021-020/

In ASQ in Stormshield Network Security (SNS) 1.0.0 through 2.7.8,
2.8.0 through 2.16.0, 3.0.0 through 3.7.20, 3.8.0 through 3.11.8, and
4.0.1 through 4.2.2, mishandling of memory management can lead to
remote code execution.

Reference: MLIST:[httpd-cvs] 20210615 svn commit: r1075782 - in /websites/staging/httpd/trunk/content: ./ security/json/CVE-2021-31618.json security/vulnerabilities_24.html
Reference: URL:https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r783b6558abf3305b17ea462bed4bd66d82866438999bf38cef6d11d1@%3Ccvs.httpd.apache.org%3E
Reference: MLIST:[httpd-cvs] 20210615 svn commit: r1890801 - /httpd/site/trunk/content/security/json/CVE-2021-31618.json
Reference: URL:https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r14b66ef0f4f569fd515a3f96cd4eb58bd9a8ff525cc326bb0359664f@%3Ccvs.httpd.apache.org%3E
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210609 CVE-2021-31618: Apache httpd: NULL pointer dereference on specially crafted HTTP/2 request
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/06/10/9

Apache HTTP Server protocol handler for the HTTP/2 protocol checks
received request headers against the size limitations as configured
for the server and used for the HTTP/1 protocol as well. On violation
of these restrictions and HTTP response is sent to the client with a
status code indicating why the request was rejected. This rejection
response was not fully initialised in the HTTP/2 protocol handler if
the offending header was the very first one received or appeared in a
a footer. This led to a NULL pointer dereference on initialised
memory, crashing reliably the child process. Since such a triggering
HTTP/2 request is easy to craft and submit, this can be exploited to
DoS the server. This issue affected mod_http2 1.15.17 and Apache HTTP
Server version 2.4.47 only. Apache HTTP Server 2.4.47 was never
released.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31619
Status: Candidate

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or
individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.
When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.

the product itself, but is intended behavior in a web browser.

Name: CVE-2021-31641
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/162887/CHIYU-IoT-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
Reference: MISC:https://gitbook.seguranca-informatica.pt/cve-and-exploits/cves/chiyu-iot-devices#cve-2021-31641
Reference: MISC:https://seguranca-informatica.pt/dancing-in-the-iot-chiyu-devices-vulnerable-to-remote-attacks/#.YLY_lXmSlPY
Reference: MISC:https://www.chiyu-tech.com/msg/message-Firmware-update-87.html

An unauthenticated XSS vulnerability exists in several IoT devices
from CHIYU Technology, including BF-630, BF-450M, BF-430, BF-431,
BF631-W, BF830-W, Webpass, BF-MINI-W, and SEMAC due to a lack of
sanitization when the HTTP 404 message is generated.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31642
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/162934/CHIYU-IoT-Denial-Of-Service.html
Reference: MISC:https://gitbook.seguranca-informatica.pt/cve-and-exploits/cves/chiyu-iot-devices#cve-2021-31642
Reference: MISC:https://seguranca-informatica.pt/dancing-in-the-iot-chiyu-devices-vulnerable-to-remote-attacks/
Reference: MISC:https://www.chiyu-tech.com/msg/message-Firmware-update-87.html

A denial of service condition exists after an integer overflow in
several IoT devices from CHIYU Technology, including BIOSENSE,
Webpass, and BF-630, BF-631, and SEMAC. The vulnerability can be
explored by sending an unexpected integer (> 32 bits) on the page
parameter that will crash the web portal and making it unavailable
until a reboot of the device.

Name: CVE-2021-31646

Reference: MISC:https://gestsup.fr/index.php?page=download&channel=beta&version=3.2.10&type=patch

Gestsup before 3.2.10 allows account takeover through the password
recovery functionality (remote). The affected component is the file
forgot_pwd.php - it uses a weak algorithm for the generation of
password recovery tokens (the PHP uniqueid function), allowing a brute
force attack.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31658
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://tp-link.com
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/liyansong2018/CVE/tree/main/2021/CVE-2021-31658

TP-Link TL-SG2005, TL-SG2008, etc. 1.0.0 Build 20180529 Rel.40524 is
affected by an Array index error. The interface that provides the
"device description" function only judges the length of the received
data, and does not filter special characters. This vulnerability will
cause the application to crash, and all device configuration
information will be erased.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31659
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://tp-link.com
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/liyansong2018/CVE/tree/main/2021/CVE-2021-31659

TP-Link TL-SG2005, TL-SG2008, etc. 1.0.0 Build 20180529 Rel.40524 is
vulnerable to Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF). All configuration
information is placed in the URL, without any additional token
authentication information. A malicious link opened by the switch
administrator may cause the password of the switch to be modified and
the configuration file to be tampered with.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-3166
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/kaisersource/kaisersource.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2021-01-17-dsl-n14u.md
Reference: MISC:https://kaisersource.github.io/dsl-n14u

An issue was discovered on ASUS DSL-N14U-B1 1.1.2.3_805 devices. An
attacker can upload arbitrary file content as a firmware update when
the filename Settings_DSL-N14U-B1.trx is used. Once this file is
loaded, shutdown measures on a wide range of services are triggered as
if it were a real update, resulting in a persistent outage of those
services.

Reference: MISC:https://github.com/ankane/pgsync/issues/121

pgsync before 0.6.7 is affected by Information Disclosure of sensitive
information. Syncing the schema with the --schema-first and --schema-
only options is mishandled. For example, the sslmode connection
parameter may be lost, which means that SSL would not be used.

Reference: MISC:https://github.com/lazyphp/PESCMS-TEAM/issues/7
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/two-kisses/pescms_vulnerability,

An issue was discovered in PESCMS-V2.3.3. There is a CSRF
vulnerability that allows attackers to delete admin and other members'
account numbers.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31682
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/164707/WebCTRL-OEM-6.5-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/3ndG4me/WebCTRL-OperatorLocale-Parameter-Reflected-XSS
Reference: MISC:https://www.automatedlogic.com/en/products-services/webctrl-building-automation-system/

The login portal for the Automated Logic WebCTRL/WebCTRL OEM web
application contains a vulnerability that allows for reflected XSS
attacks due to the operatorlocale GET parameter not being sanitized.
This issue impacts versions 6.5 and below. This issue works by passing
in a basic XSS payload to a vulnerable GET parameter that is reflected
in the output without sanitization.

Reference: MISC:https://pastebin.com/yv4ajFjD
Reference: MISC:https://www.akuvox.com/ProductsDisp.aspx?pid=21

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31727
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/irql0/CVE-2021-31728/blob/master/CVE-2021-31727.md

Incorrect access control in zam64.sys, zam32.sys in MalwareFox
AntiMalware 2.74.0.150 where IOCTL's 0x80002014, 0x80002018 expose
unrestricted disk read/write capabilities respectively. A non-
privileged process can open a handle to \.\ZemanaAntiMalware, register
with the driver using IOCTL 0x80002010 and send these IOCTL's to
escalate privileges by overwriting the boot sector or overwriting
critical code in the pagefile.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31728
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/irql0/CVE-2021-31728/blob/master/CVE-2021-31728.md

Incorrect access control in zam64.sys, zam32.sys in MalwareFox
AntiMalware 2.74.0.150 allows a non-privileged process to open a
handle to \.\ZemanaAntiMalware, register itself with the driver by
sending IOCTL 0x80002010, allocate executable memory using a flaw in
IOCTL 0x80002040, install a hook with IOCTL 0x80002044 and execute the
executable memory using this hook with IOCTL 0x80002014 or 0x80002018,
this exposes ring 0 code execution in the context of the driver
allowing the non-privileged process to elevate privileges.

Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pluck-cms/pluck/issues/99

Session Fixation vulnerability in login.php in Pluck-CMS Pluck 4.7.15
allows an attacker to sustain unauthorized access to the platform.

change, access can be sustained even after an administrator performs
regular remediation attempts such as resetting their password.

/gofrom/setwanType allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on the

controlled by malicious attack get copied to the stack variable.

Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Yu3H0/IoT_CVE/tree/main/Tenda/CVE_4

02.03.01.104_CN. A stack buffer overflow vulnerability in
/goform/setVLAN allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on the
system via a crafted post request.

Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Yu3H0/IoT_CVE/tree/main/Tenda/CVE_2

An issue was discovered on Tenda AC11 devices with firmware through
02.03.01.104_CN. A stack buffer overflow vulnerability in
/goform/setportList allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on the
system via a crafted post request.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31769
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/bc0d3/6d55866a78f66569383241406e18794f

MyQ Server in MyQ X Smart before 8.2 allows remote code execution by
unprivileged users because administrative session data can be read in
the %PROGRAMFILES%\MyQ\PHP\Sessions directory. The "Select server
file" feature is only intended for administrators but actually does
not require authorization. An attacker can inject arbitrary OS
commands (such as commands to create new .php files) via the Task
Scheduler component.

Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20220212 [SECURITY] [DLA 2919-1] python2.7 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/02/msg00013.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20230524 [SECURITY] [DLA 3432-1] python2.7 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/05/msg00024.html
Reference: MLIST:[mina-dev] 20210225 [jira] [Created] (FTPSERVER-500) Security vulnerability in common/lib/log4j-1.2.17.jar
Reference: URL:https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E

Python 3.x through 3.9.1 has a buffer overflow in PyCArg_repr in
_ctypes/callproc.c, which may lead to remote code execution in certain
Python applications that accept floating-point numbers as untrusted
input, as demonstrated by a 1e300 argument to c_double.from_param.
This occurs because sprintf is used unsafely.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-3178
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-3bcc7198c8
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5SGB7TNDVQEOJ7NVTGX56UWHDNQM5TRC/
Reference: MISC:https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=51b2ee7d006a736a9126e8111d1f24e4fd0afaa6
Reference: MISC:https://patchwork.kernel.org/project/linux-nfs/patch/20210111210129.GA11652@fieldses.org/
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20210309 [SECURITY] [DLA 2586-1] linux security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/03/msg00010.html

** DISPUTED ** fs/nfsd/nfs3xdr.c in the Linux kernel through 5.10.8,
when there is an NFS export of a subdirectory of a filesystem, allows
remote attackers to traverse to other parts of the filesystem via
READDIRPLUS. NOTE: some parties argue that such a subdirectory export
is not intended to prevent this attack; see also the exports(5)
no_subtree_check default behavior.

Name: CVE-2021-31780

In app/Model/MispObject.php in MISP 2.4.141, an incorrect sharing
group association could lead to information disclosure on an event
edit. When an object has a sharing group associated with an event
edit, the sharing group object is ignored and instead the passed local
ID is reused.

Name: CVE-2021-31784
Status: Candidate

An out-of-bounds write vulnerability exists in the file-reading
procedure in Open Design Alliance Drawings SDK before 2021.6 on all

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31785
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/general/braktooth.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://launchstudio.bluetooth.com/ListingDetails/76427
Reference: MISC:https://www.actions-semi.com/index.php?id=3581&siteId=4

The Bluetooth Classic implementation on Actions ATS2815 and ATS2819
chipsets does not properly handle the reception of multiple
LMP_host_connection_req packets, allowing attackers in radio range to
trigger a denial of service (deadlock) of the device via crafted LMP
packets. Manual user intervention is required to restart the device
and restore Bluetooth communication.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31786
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/general/braktooth.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://launchstudio.bluetooth.com/ListingDetails/76427
Reference: MISC:https://www.actions-semi.com/index.php?id=3581&siteId=4

The Bluetooth Classic Audio implementation on Actions ATS2815 and
ATS2819 devices does not properly handle a connection attempt from a
host with the same BDAddress as the current connected BT host,
allowing attackers to trigger a disconnection and deadlock of the
device by connecting with a forged BDAddress that matches the original
connected host.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31787
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/general/braktooth.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://launchstudio.bluetooth.com/ListingDetails/76427
Reference: MISC:https://www.actions-semi.com/index.php?id=3581&siteId=4

The Bluetooth Classic implementation on Actions ATS2815 chipsets does
not properly handle the reception of continuous unsolicited LMP
responses, allowing attackers in radio range to trigger a denial of
service and shutdown of a device by flooding the target device with
LMP_features_res packets.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31796
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/164023/CyberArk-Credential-File-Insufficient-Effective-Key-Space.html
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/1
Reference: MISC:https://korelogic.com/Resources/Advisories/KL-001-2021-008.txt
Reference: MISC:https://www.cyberark.com/resources/blog

An inadequate encryption vulnerability discovered in CyberArk
Credential Provider before 12.1 may lead to Information Disclosure. An
attacker may realistically have enough information that the number of
possible keys (for a credential file) is only one, and the number is
usually not higher than 2^36.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31797
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/164033/CyberArk-Credential-Provider-Race-Condition-Authorization-Bypass.html
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/2

Reference: MISC:https://www.cyberark.com/resources/blog

The user identification mechanism used by CyberArk Credential Provider
prior to 12.1 is susceptible to a local host race condition, leading
to password disclosure.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31798
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/164035/CyberArk-Credential-Provider-Local-Cache-Decryption.html
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/3
Reference: MISC:https://korelogic.com/Resources/Advisories/KL-001-2021-010.txt
Reference: MISC:https://www.cyberark.com/resources/blog

The effective key space used to encrypt the cache in CyberArk
Credential Provider prior to 12.1 has low entropy, and under certain
conditions a local malicious user can obtain the plaintext of cache
files.

Name: CVE-2021-31799
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0004/

Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202401-05

Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2021/05/02/os-command-injection-in-rdoc/
Reference: URL:https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2021/05/02/os-command-injection-in-rdoc/
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20211013 [SECURITY] [DLA 2780-1] ruby2.3 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/10/msg00009.html

In RDoc 3.11 through 6.x before 6.3.1, as distributed with Ruby
through 3.0.1, it is possible to execute arbitrary code via | and tags
in a filename.

Name: CVE-2021-3180
Status: Candidate

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or
individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.
When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31800
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-52dfb60726
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/UF56LYB27LHEIFJTFHU3M75NMNNK2SCG/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-888ccfd5b6
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IPXDPWCAPVX3UWYZ3N2T5OLBSBBUHJP6/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-ab09c9a7a1
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KRV2C5DATXBHG6TF6CEEX54KZ75THQS3/
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/SecureAuthCorp/impacket/blob/cb6d43a677c338db930bc4e9161620832c1ec624/impacket/smbserver.py#L2008
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/SecureAuthCorp/impacket/blob/cb6d43a677c338db930bc4e9161620832c1ec624/impacket/smbserver.py#L2958
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/SecureAuthCorp/impacket/blob/cb6d43a677c338db930bc4e9161620832c1ec624/impacket/smbserver.py#L3485
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/SecureAuthCorp/impacket/blob/cb6d43a677c338db930bc4e9161620832c1ec624/impacket/smbserver.py#L876
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/SecureAuthCorp/impacket/commit/49c643bf66620646884ed141c94e5fdd85bcdd2f
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/SecureAuthCorp/impacket/releases

Multiple path traversal vulnerabilities exist in smbserver.py in
Impacket through 0.9.22. An attacker that connects to a running
smbserver instance can list and write to arbitrary files via ../
directory traversal. This could potentially be abused to achieve
arbitrary code execution by replacing /etc/shadow or an SSH authorized
key.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31801
Status: Candidate

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or
individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.
When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31802
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://ssd-disclosure.com/ssd-advisory-netgear-nighthawk-r7000-httpd-preauth-rce/
Reference: MISC:https://www.netgear.com/about/security/

NETGEAR R7000 1.0.11.116 devices have a heap-based Buffer Overflow
that is exploitable from the local network without authentication. The
vulnerability exists within the handling of an HTTP request. An
attacker can leverage this to execute code as root. The problem is
that a user-provided length value is trusted during a backup.cgi file
upload. The attacker must add a \n before the Content-Length header.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31803
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://docs.cpanel.net/changelogs/94-change-log/

cPanel before 94.0.3 allows self-XSS via EasyApache 4 Save Profile
(SEC-581).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31804
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/leozide/leocad/issues/645

LeoCAD before 21.03 sometimes allows a use-after-free during the
opening of a new document.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31805
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220420-0001/
Reference: URL:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220420-0001/
Reference: MISC:https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-062
Reference: URL:https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-062
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujul2022.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujul2022.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20220412 CVE-2021-31805: Apache Struts: Forced OGNL evaluation, when evaluated on raw not validated user input in tag attributes, may lead to RCE.
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/04/12/6

The fix issued for CVE-2020-17530 was incomplete. So from Apache
Struts 2.0.0 to 2.5.29, still some of the tag&#8217;s attributes could
perform a double evaluation if a developer applied forced OGNL
evaluation by using the %{...} syntax. Using forced OGNL evaluation on
untrusted user input can lead to a Remote Code Execution and security
degradation.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31806
Status: Candidate

An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.15 and 5.x before 5.0.6. Due
to a memory-management bug, it is vulnerable to a Denial of Service
attack (against all clients using the proxy) via HTTP Range request
processing.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31807
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210716-0007/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-24af72ff2c
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/T4EPIWUZDJAXADDHVOPKRBTQHPBR6H66/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-c0bec55ec7
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/LSQ3U54ZCNXR44QRPW3AV2VCS6K3TKCF/
Reference: FULLDISC:20231016 Squid Caching Proxy Security Audit: 55 Vulnerabilities, 35 0days.
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2023/Oct/14
Reference: MISC:http://www.squid-cache.org/Versions/v4/changesets/squid-4-e7cf864f938f24eea8af0692c04d16790983c823.patch
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/squid-cache/squid/security/advisories/GHSA-pxwq-f3qr-w2xf
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20210614 [SECURITY] [DLA 2685-1] squid3 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00014.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20231011 Squid Caching Proxy Security Audit: 55 Vulnerabilities, 35 0days.
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/10/11/3

An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.15 and 5.x before 5.0.6. An
integer overflow problem allows a remote server to achieve Denial of
Service when delivering responses to HTTP Range requests. The issue
trigger is a header that can be expected to exist in HTTP traffic
without any malicious intent.

An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.15 and 5.x before 5.0.6. Due
to an input-validation bug, it is vulnerable to a Denial of Service
attack (against all clients using the proxy). A client sends an HTTP
Range request to trigger this.

Name: CVE-2021-3181
Status: Candidate
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4838
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4838
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-4205e1fc23
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/DXGWXFO77HBCD3VYEIYHHYU33LYWWWNQ/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-a4f016c6c8
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/P2OMLQKAOHPYQA4GI7ZUO6UKCPUHLYO7/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202101-25
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-25
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/-/commit/4a2becbdb4422aaffe3ce314991b9d670b7adf17
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/-/commit/939b02b33ae29bc0d642570c1dcfd4b339037d19
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/-/commit/d4305208955c5cdd9fe96dfa61e7c1e14e176a14
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/-/issues/323
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20210120 [SECURITY] [DLA 2529-1] mutt security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/01/msg00017.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210119 Re: mutt recipient parsing memory leak
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/19/10
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210127 glibc iconv crash with ISO-2022-JP-3
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/27/3

rfc822.c in Mutt through 2.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (mailbox unavailability) by sending email messages
with sequences of semicolon characters in RFC822 address fields (aka
terminators of empty groups). A small email message from the attacker
can cause large memory consumption, and the victim may then be unable
to see email messages from other persons.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31810
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210917-0001/
Reference: URL:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210917-0001/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-36cdab1f8d
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/MWXHK5UUHVSHF7HTHMX6JY3WXDVNIHSL/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202401-27
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202401-27
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/1145454
Reference: URL:https://hackerone.com/reports/1145454
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2021/07/07/trusting-pasv-responses-in-net-ftp/
Reference: URL:https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2021/07/07/trusting-pasv-responses-in-net-ftp/
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20211013 [SECURITY] [DLA 2780-1] ruby2.3 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/10/msg00009.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20230430 [SECURITY] [DLA 3408-1] jruby security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/04/msg00033.html

An issue was discovered in Ruby through 2.6.7, 2.7.x through 2.7.3,
and 3.x through 3.0.1. A malicious FTP server can use the PASV
response to trick Net::FTP into connecting back to a given IP address
and port. This potentially makes curl extract information about
services that are otherwise private and not disclosed (e.g., the
attacker can conduct port scans and service banner extractions).

Reference: MLIST:[ofbiz-notifications] 20210613 [jira] [Updated] (OFBIZ-12256) Update PDFBox to 2.0.24 because of CVE-2021-31811 & CVE-2021-31812
Reference: URL:https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rfe26bcaba564deb505c32711ba68df7ec589797dcd96ff3389a8aaba@%3Cnotifications.ofbiz.apache.org%3E
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210612 CVE-2021-31812: Apache PDFBox: A carefully crafted PDF file can trigger an infinite loop while loading the file
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/06/12/1

loop while loading the file. This issue affects Apache PDFBox version
2.0.23 and prior 2.0.x versions.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31814
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://advisories.stormshield.eu/
Reference: MISC:https://advisories.stormshield.eu/2021-019/

In Stormshield 1.1.0, and 2.1.0 through 2.9.0, an attacker can block a

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31815
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://blog.appcensus.io/2021/04/27/why-google-should-stop-logging-contact-tracing-data/
Reference: MISC:https://themarkup.org/privacy/2021/04/27/google-promised-its-contact-tracing-app-was-completely-private-but-it-wasnt

GAEN (aka Google/Apple Exposure Notifications) through 2021-04-27 on
Android allows attackers to obtain sensitive information, such as a
user's location history, in-person social graph, and (sometimes)
COVID-19 infection status, because Rolling Proximity Identifiers and
MAC addresses are written to the Android system log, and many Android
devices have applications (preinstalled by the hardware manufacturer
or network operator) that read system log data and send it to third
parties. NOTE: a news outlet (The Markup) states that they received a
vendor response indicating that fix deployment "began several weeks
ago and will be complete in the coming days."

SQL database, on initial configuration the database password is
written to the OctopusServer.txt log file in plaintext.

Name: CVE-2021-31827
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://community.progress.com/s/article/MOVEit-Transfer-Vulnerability-April-2021
Reference: MISC:https://docs.ipswitch.com/MOVEit/Transfer2021/ReleaseNotes/en/index.htm
Reference: MISC:https://www.progress.com/moveit

In Progress MOVEit Transfer before 2021.0 (13.0), a SQL injection
vulnerability has been found in the MOVEit Transfer web app that could
allow an authenticated attacker to gain unauthorized access to MOVEit
Transfer's database. Depending on the database engine being used
(MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, or Azure SQL), an attacker may be able
to infer information about the structure and contents of the database
in addition to executing SQL statements that alter or destroy database
elements. This is in MOVEit.DMZ.WebApp in SILHuman.vb.

Name: CVE-2021-31829
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-5ad5249c43
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VWCZ6LJLENL2C3URW5ICARTACXPFCFN2/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-7c085ca697
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZI7OBCJQDNWMKLBP6MZ5NV4EUTDAMX6Q/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-9c0276e935
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/Y4X2G5YAPYJGI3PFEZZNOTRYI33GOCCZ/
Reference: MISC:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/05/04/4
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/801c6058d14a82179a7ee17a4b532cac6fad067f
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20210623 [SECURITY] [DLA 2690-1] linux-4.19 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00019.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210504 [CVE-2021-31829] Linux kernel protection of stack pointer against speculative pointer arithmetic can be bypassed to leak content of kernel memory
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/05/04/4

kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernel through 5.12.1 performs
undesirable speculative loads, leading to disclosure of stack content
via side-channel attacks, aka CID-801c6058d14a. The specific concern
is not protecting the BPF stack area against speculative loads. Also,
the BPF stack can contain uninitialized data that might represent
sensitive information previously operated on by the kernel.

Files.com Fat Client 3.3.6 allows authentication bypass because the
client continues to have access after a logout and a removal of a
login profile.

Potential product security bypass vulnerability in McAfee Application
and Change Control (MACC) prior to version 8.3.4 allows a locally
logged in attacker to circumvent the application solidification
protection provided by MACC, permitting them to run applications that
would usually be prevented by MACC. This would require the attacker to
rename the specified binary to match name of any configured updater
and perform a specific set of steps, resulting in the renamed binary
to be to run.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31840
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10362
Reference: URL:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10362

A vulnerability in the preloading mechanism of specific dynamic link
libraries in McAfee Agent for Windows prior to 5.7.3 could allow an
authenticated, local attacker to perform a DLL preloading attack with
unsigned DLLs. To exploit this vulnerability, the attacker would need
to have valid credentials on the Windows system. This would result in
the user gaining elevated permissions and being able to execute
arbitrary code.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31841
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10369

5.7.4 could allow a local user to perform a DLL sideloading attack
with an unsigned DLL with a specific name and in a specific location.
This would result in the user gaining elevated permissions and the
ability to execute arbitrary code as the system user, through not
checking the DLL signature.

Name: CVE-2021-31843

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31844
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10368
Reference: URL:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10368

A buffer overflow vulnerability in McAfee Data Loss Prevention (DLP)
Endpoint for Windows prior to 11.6.200 allows a local attacker to
execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges through placing
carefully constructed Ami Pro (.sam) files onto the local system and
triggering a DLP Endpoint scan through accessing a file. This is
caused by the destination buffer being of fixed size and incorrect
checks being made on the source size.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31845
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10368
Reference: URL:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10368

A buffer overflow vulnerability in McAfee Data Loss Prevention (DLP)
Discover prior to 11.6.100 allows an attacker in the same network as
the DLP Discover to execute arbitrary code through placing carefully
constructed Ami Pro (.sam) files onto a machine and having DLP
Discover scan it, leading to remote code execution with elevated
privileges. This is caused by the destination buffer being of fixed
size and incorrect checks being made on the source size.

Name: CVE-2021-31850
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10358
Reference: URL:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10358
Reference: MISC:https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-21-1535/

A denial-of-service vulnerability in Database Security (DBS) prior to
4.8.4 allows a remote authenticated administrator to trigger a denial-
of-service attack against the DBS server. The configuration of
Archiving through the User interface incorrectly allowed the creation
of directories and files in Windows system directories and other
locations where sensitive data could be overwritten. The former could
lead to a DoS, whilst the latter could lead to data destruction on the
DBS server.

Name: CVE-2021-31851
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10372
Reference: URL:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10372

A Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability in McAfee Policy
Auditor prior to 6.5.2 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to
inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the profileNodeID request
parameters. The malicious script is reflected unmodified into the
Policy Auditor web-based interface which could lead to the extraction
of end user session token or login credentials. These may be used to
access additional security-critical applications or conduct arbitrary
cross-domain requests.

Auditor prior to 6.5.2 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to
inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the UID request parameter. The
malicious script is reflected unmodified into the Policy Auditor web-
based interface which could lead to the extract of end user session
token or login credentials. These may be used to access additional
security-critical applications or conduct arbitrary cross-domain
requests.

Name: CVE-2021-31853
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10374
Reference: URL:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10374

DLL Search Order Hijacking Vulnerability in McAfee Drive Encryption
(MDE) prior to 7.3.0 HF2 (7.3.0.183) allows local users to execute
arbitrary code and escalate privileges via execution from a
compromised folder.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31854
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10378
Reference: URL:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10378

A command Injection Vulnerability in McAfee Agent (MA) for Windows
prior to 5.7.5 allows local users to inject arbitrary shell code into
the file cleanup.exe. The malicious clean.exe file is placed into the
relevant folder and executed by running the McAfee Agent deployment
feature located in the System Tree. An attacker may exploit the
vulnerability to obtain a reverse shell which can lead to privilege
escalation to obtain root privileges.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31855
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/KDE/messagelib/commit/3b5b171e91ce78b966c98b1292a1bcbc8d984799
Reference: MISC:https://kde.org/info/security/advisory-20210429-1.txt

KDE Messagelib through 5.17.0 reveals cleartext of encrypted messages
in some situations. Deleting an attachment of a decrypted encrypted
message stored on a remote server (e.g., an IMAP server) causes KMail
to upload the decrypted content of the message to the remote server.
With a crafted message, a user could be tricked into decrypting an
encrypted message and then deleting an attachment attached to this
message. If the attacker has access to the messages stored on the
email server, then the attacker could read the decrypted content of
the encrypted message. This occurs in ViewerPrivate::deleteAttachment
in messageviewer/src/viewer/viewer_p.cpp.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31856
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/layer5io/meshery/pull/2745
Reference: MISC:https://meshery.io

A SQL Injection vulnerability in the REST API in Layer5 Meshery 0.5.2
allows an attacker to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the
/experimental/patternfiles endpoint (order parameter in
GetMesheryPatterns in models/meshery_pattern_persister.go).

In Zoho ManageEngine Password Manager Pro before 11.1 build 11104,

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31875
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/418sec/mjs/pull/2
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/cesanta/mjs/releases/tag/1.26
Reference: MISC:https://huntr.dev/bounties/1-other-mjs/

** DISPUTED ** In mjs_json.c in Cesanta MongooseOS mJS 1.26, a
maliciously formed JSON string can trigger an off-by-one heap-based
buffer overflow in mjs_json_parse, which can potentially lead to
redirection of control flow. NOTE: the original reporter disputes the
significance of this finding because "there isn&#8217;t very much of an
opportunity to exploit this reliably for an information leak, so there
isn&#8217;t any real security impact."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31876
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bitcoinops.org/en/newsletters/2021/05/12/
Reference: MISC:https://bitcoinops.org/en/topics/replace-by-fee/
Reference: MISC:https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Common_Vulnerabilities_and_Exposures#CVE-2021-31876
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin
Reference: MISC:https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2021-May/018893.html

Bitcoin Core 0.12.0 through 0.21.1 does not properly implement the
replacement policy specified in BIP125, which makes it easier for
attackers to trigger a loss of funds, or a denial of service attack
against downstream projects such as Lightning network nodes. An
unconfirmed child transaction with nSequence = 0xff_ff_ff_ff, spending
an unconfirmed parent with nSequence <= 0xff_ff_ff_fd, should be
replaceable because there is inherited signaling by the child
transaction. However, the actual PreChecks implementation does not
enforce this. Instead, mempool rejects the replacement attempt of the
unconfirmed child transaction.

reference providing provenance. Notes: none.

Compact (BACnet) (All versions < V3.5.4), TALON TC Modular (BACnet)
(All versions < V3.5.4). When processing a DHCP ACK message, the DHCP
client application does not validate the length of the Vendor
option(s), leading to Denial-of-Service conditions. (FSMD-2021-0013)

Name: CVE-2021-31891
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-535380.pdf
Reference: URL:https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-535380.pdf

A vulnerability has been identified in Desigo CC (All versions with
OIS Extension Module), GMA-Manager (All versions with OIS running on
Debian 9 or earlier), Operation Scheduler (All versions with OIS
running on Debian 9 or earlier), Siveillance Control (All versions
with OIS running on Debian 9 or earlier), Siveillance Control Pro (All
versions). The affected application incorrectly neutralizes special
elements in a specific HTTP GET request which could lead to command
injection. An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit this
vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with root
privileges.

(All versions). Due to an error in a third-party dependency the ssl
flags used for setting up a TLS connection to a server are overwitten
with wrong settings. This results in a missing validation of the
server certificate and thus in a possible TLS MITM szenario.

(All versions), SIMATIC PCS 7 V9.X (All versions < V9.1 SP2), SIMATIC
PDM (All versions < V9.2 SP2), SIMATIC STEP 7 V5.X (All versions <
V5.7), SINAMICS STARTER (containing STEP 7 OEM version) (All versions
< V5.4 SP2 HF1). A directory containing metafiles relevant to devices'
configurations has write permissions. An attacker could leverage this
vulnerability by changing the content of certain metafiles and
subsequently manipulate parameters or behavior of devices that would
be later configured by the affected software.

in affected devices fails to properly sanitize incoming DHCP packets.
This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to cause memory to
be overwritten, potentially allowing remote code execution.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31916
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1946965
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1946965
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/4edbe1d7bcffcd6269f3b5eb63f710393ff2ec7a
Reference: URL:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/4edbe1d7bcffcd6269f3b5eb63f710393ff2ec7a
Reference: MISC:https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2021/q1/268
Reference: URL:https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2021/q1/268
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20210623 [SECURITY] [DLA 2689-1] linux security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00020.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20210623 [SECURITY] [DLA 2690-1] linux-4.19 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00019.html

An out-of-bounds (OOB) memory write flaw was found in list_devices in
drivers/md/dm-ioctl.c in the Multi-device driver module in the Linux
kernel before 5.12. A bound check failure allows an attacker with
special user (CAP_SYS_ADMIN) privilege to gain access to out-of-bounds
memory leading to a system crash or a leak of internal kernel
information. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system
availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31917
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-31917
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-31917

A flaw was found in Red Hat DataGrid 8.x (8.0.0, 8.0.1, 8.1.0 and
8.1.1) and Infinispan (10.0.0 through 12.0.0). An attacker could
bypass authentication on all REST endpoints when DIGEST is used as the
authentication method. The highest threat from this vulnerability is
to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Traffic Manager before 21.1 could allow an attacker to smuggle an HTTP

Name: CVE-2021-31923
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://docs.pingidentity.com/bundle/pingaccess-53/page/wco1629833104567.html
Reference: URL:https://docs.pingidentity.com/bundle/pingaccess-53/page/wco1629833104567.html

Ping Identity PingAccess before 5.3.3 allows HTTP request smuggling

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31924
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-724f4733e9
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IL3I5AKECLMK4ADLLACLOEF7H5CMNDP2/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-a52d48b1c2
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/CRBVOZEMVO72FV4Z5O4GBGSURXHWRGD3/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202208-11
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-11
Reference: MISC:https://developers.yubico.com/pam-u2f/
Reference: MISC:https://www.yubico.com/support/security-advisories/ysa-2021-03

Yubico pam-u2f before 1.1.1 has a logic issue that, depending on the
pam-u2f configuration and the application used, could lead to a local
PIN bypass. This issue does not allow user presence (touch) or
cryptographic signature verification to be bypassed, so an attacker
would still need to physically possess and interact with the YubiKey
or another enrolled authenticator. If pam-u2f is configured to require
PIN authentication, and the application using pam-u2f allows the user
to submit NULL as the PIN, pam-u2f will attempt to perform a FIDO2
authentication without PIN. If this authentication is successful, the
PIN requirement is bypassed.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31925
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://docs.pexip.com/admin/security_bulletins.htm#CVE-2021-31925
Reference: MISC:https://docs.pexip.com/admin/security_bulletins.htm

Pexip Infinity 25.x before 25.4 has Improper Input Validation, and
thus an unauthenticated remote attacker can cause a denial of service
via the administrative web interface.

Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/CubeCoders/AMP/issues/443

AMP Application Deployment Service in CubeCoders AMP 2.1.x before
2.1.1.2 allows a remote, authenticated user to open ports in the local
system firewall by crafting an HTTP(S) request directly to the
applicable API endpoint (despite not having permission to make changes
to the system's network configuration).

Persistent cross-site scripting (XSS) in the web interface of Concerto
through 2.3.6 allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to introduce
arbitrary JavaScript by injecting an XSS payload into the First Name
or Last Name parameter upon registration. When a privileged user
attempts to delete the account, the XSS payload will be executed.

Name: CVE-2021-31933
Status: Candidate

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Chamilo through
1.11.14 due to improper input sanitization of a parameter used for
file uploads, and improper file-extension filtering for certain
filenames (e.g., .phar or .pht). A remote authenticated administrator
is able to upload a file containing arbitrary PHP code into specific
directories via main/inc/lib/fileUpload.lib.php directory traversal to
achieve PHP code execution.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31937

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-3195
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20866

** DISPUTED ** bitcoind in Bitcoin Core through 0.21.0 can create a
new file in an arbitrary directory (e.g., outside the ~/.bitcoin
directory) via a dumpwallet RPC call. NOTE: this reportedly does not
violate the security model of Bitcoin Core, but can violate the
security model of a fork that has implemented dumpwallet restrictions.

Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-3196
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.hitachi-id.com/cve-2021-3196-attackers-can-impersonate-another-user
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.hitachi.com/hirt/hitachi-sec/2021/601.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.hitachi.com/hirt/security/index.html

An issue was discovered in Hitachi ID Bravura Security Fabric 11.0.0
through 11.1.3, 12.0.0 through 12.0.2, and 12.1.0. When using
federated identity management (authenticating via SAML through a
third-party identity provider), an attacker can inject additional data
into a signed SAML response being transmitted to the service provider
(ID Bravura Security Fabric). The application successfully validates
the signed values but uses the unsigned malicious values. An attacker
with lower-privilege access to the application can inject the username
of a high-privilege user to impersonate that user.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-31960
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2021-31960

recommends that users apply the NPCT75x TPM 1.2 firmware update.

endpoint permitted the listing of the content of the remote file
system. This can be used to identify the complete server filesystem
structure, i.e., identifying all the directories and files.

API was vulnerable to arbitrary file reading due to an improper
limitation of file loading on the server filesystem, aka directory
traversal.

Name: CVE-2021-32027
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210713-0004/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202211-04
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202211-04
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1956876
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1956876
Reference: MISC:https://www.postgresql.org/support/security/CVE-2021-32027/
Reference: URL:https://www.postgresql.org/support/security/CVE-2021-32027/

A flaw was found in postgresql in versions before 13.3, before 12.7,
before 11.12, before 10.17 and before 9.6.22. While modifying certain
SQL array values, missing bounds checks let authenticated database
users write arbitrary bytes to a wide area of server memory. The
highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and
integrity as well as system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-32028
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211112-0003/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202211-04
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202211-04
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1956877
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1956877
Reference: MISC:https://www.postgresql.org/support/security/CVE-2021-32028
Reference: URL:https://www.postgresql.org/support/security/CVE-2021-32028

A flaw was found in postgresql. Using an INSERT ... ON CONFLICT ... DO
UPDATE command on a purpose-crafted table, an authenticated database
user could read arbitrary bytes of server memory. The highest threat
from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

arbitrary bytes of server memory. The highest threat from this

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-32030
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/atredispartners/advisories/blob/master/ATREDIS-2020-0010.md
Reference: MISC:https://www.asus.com/Networking-IoT-Servers/WiFi-Routers/ASUS-Gaming-Routers/RT-AC2900/HelpDesk_BIOS/

The administrator application on ASUS GT-AC2900 devices before
3.0.0.4.386.42643 allows authentication bypass when processing remote
input from an unauthenticated user, leading to unauthorized access to
the administrator interface. This relates to handle_request in
router/httpd/httpd.c and auth_check in web_hook.o. An attacker-
supplied value of '\0' matches the device's default value of '\0' in
some situations.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-32032
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://git.trustedfirmware.org/TF-M/trusted-firmware-m.git/tree/docs/security/security_advisories/crypto_multi_part_ops_abort_fail.rst
Reference: MISC:https://git.trustedfirmware.org/TF-M/trusted-firmware-m.git/commit/?id=7e2e523a1c4e9ac7b9cc4fd551831f7639ed5ff9
Reference: MISC:https://www.trustedfirmware.org

In Trusted Firmware-M through 1.3.0, cleaning up the memory allocated
for a multi-part cryptographic operation (in the event of a failure)
can prevent the abort() operation in the associated cryptographic
library from freeing internal resources, causing a memory leak.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-32033
Status: Candidate
Reference: FULLDISC:20210618 [SYSS-2021-007]: Protectimus SLIM NFC - External Control of System or Configuration Setting (CWE-15) (CVE-2021-32033)
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Jun/39
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/163223/Protectimus-SLIM-NFC-Time-Manipulation.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.syss.de/fileadmin/dokumente/Publikationen/Advisories/SYSS-2021-007.txt

Protectimus SLIM NFC 70 10.01 devices allow a Time Traveler attack in
which attackers can predict TOTP passwords in certain situations. The
time value used by the device can be set independently from the used
seed value for generating time-based one-time passwords, without
authentication. Thus, an attacker with short-time physical access to a
device can set the internal real-time clock (RTC) to the future,
generate one-time passwords, and reset the clock to the current time.
This allows the generation of valid future time-based one-time
passwords without having further access to the hardware token.

======================================================

will be provided.
