======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-3322
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-p86r-gc4r-4mq3
Reference: URL:http://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-p86r-gc4r-4mq3

Unexpected Pointer Aliasing in IEEE 802154 Fragment Reassembly in
Zephyr. Zephyr versions >= >=2.4.0 contain NULL Pointer Dereference
(CWE-476). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-
rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-p86r-gc4r-4mq3

======================================================

Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/May/73
Reference: MISC:https://korelogic.com/advisories.html

An issue was discovered in CommScope Ruckus IoT Controller 1.7.1.0 and
earlier. Hard-coded API Keys exist.

Name: CVE-2021-3325
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.monitorix.org/news.html?n=20210127
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-5f7da70bfe
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/67DDUU56LP76AJ2K7WJ733QPL2FHKKNG/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-fc24737ebc
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IGG6WK44CYY6GEFRTCUEDANVNSX5NDH7/
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/mikaku/Monitorix/commit/d6816e20da1a98bcdc6372d9c36a093df5238f4a
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/mikaku/Monitorix/compare/v3.13.0...v3.13.1
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/mikaku/Monitorix/issues/309

Monitorix 3.13.0 allows remote attackers to bypass Basic
Authentication in a default installation (i.e., an installation
without a hosts_deny option). This issue occurred because a new
access-control feature was introduced without considering that some
exiting installations became unsafe, upon an update to 3.13.0, unless
the new feature was immediately configured.

Name: CVE-2021-33256
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://docs.unsafe-inline.com/0day/manageengine-adselfservice-plus-6.1-csv-injection

** DISPUTED ** A CSV injection vulnerability on the login panel of
ManageEngine ADSelfService Plus Version: 6.1 Build No: 6101 can be
exploited by an unauthenticated user. The j_username parameter seems
to be vulnerable and a reverse shell could be obtained if a privileged
user exports "User Attempts Audit Report" as CSV file. Note: The
vendor disputes this vulnerability, claiming "This is not a valid
vulnerability in our ADSSP product. We don't see this as a security
issue at our side."

Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202107-07

Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20221017 [SECURITY] [DLA 3152-1] glibc security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/10/msg00021.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210128 Re: glibc iconv crash with ISO-2022-JP-3
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/28/2

The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and
earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3
encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program,
potentially resulting in a denial of service.

Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210830 NTFS3G-SA-2021-0001: Multiple buffer overflows in all versions of NTFS-3G
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/30/1

In NTFS-3G versions < 2021.8.22, when a specially crafted NTFS
attribute is supplied to the function ntfs_get_attribute_value, a heap
buffer overflow can occur allowing for memory disclosure or denial of
service. The vulnerability is caused by an out-of-bound buffer access
which can be triggered by mounting a crafted ntfs partition. The root
cause is a missing consistency check after reading an MFT record : the
"bytes_in_use" field should be less than the "bytes_allocated" field.
When it is not, the parsing of the records proceeds into the wild.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33286
Status: Candidate
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4971
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4971
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202301-01
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202301-01
Reference: MISC:http://ntfs-3g.com
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/tuxera/ntfs-3g/security/advisories/GHSA-q759-8j5v-q5jp
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20211116 [SECURITY] [DLA 2819-1] ntfs-3g security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/11/msg00013.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210830 NTFS3G-SA-2021-0001: Multiple buffer overflows in all versions of NTFS-3G
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/30/1

In NTFS-3G versions < 2021.8.22, when a specially crafted unicode
string is supplied in an NTFS image a heap buffer overflow can occur
and allow for code execution.

Status: Candidate
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4971
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4971

Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202301-01
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202301-01
Reference: MISC:http://ntfs-3g.com
Reference: MISC:http://tuxera.com
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/tuxera/ntfs-3g/security/advisories/GHSA-q759-8j5v-q5jp
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20211116 [SECURITY] [DLA 2819-1] ntfs-3g security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/11/msg00013.html

In NTFS-3G versions < 2021.8.22, when specially crafted NTFS
attributes are read in the function ntfs_attr_pread_i, a heap buffer
overflow can occur and allow for writing to arbitrary memory or denial
of service of the application.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33315
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.trendnet.com/support/view.asp?cat=4&id=81

The TRENDnet TI-PG1284i switch(hw v2.0R) prior to version 2.0.2.S0
suffers from an integer underflow vulnerability. This vulnerability
exists in its lldp related component. Due to lack of proper validation
on length field of PortID TLV, by sending a crafted lldp packet to the
device, integer underflow would occur and the negative number will be
passed to memcpy() later, which may cause buffer overflow or invalid
memory access.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33316
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.trendnet.com/support/view.asp?cat=4&id=81

The TRENDnet TI-PG1284i switch(hw v2.0R) prior to version 2.0.2.S0
suffers from an integer underflow vulnerability. This vulnerability
exists in its lldp related component. Due to lack of proper validation
on length field of ChassisID TLV, by sending a crafted lldp packet to
the device, integer underflow would occur and the negative number will
be passed to memcpy() later, which may cause buffer overflow or
invalid memory access.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33317
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.trendnet.com/support/view.asp?cat=4&id=81

The TRENDnet TI-PG1284i switch(hw v2.0R) prior to version 2.0.2.S0
suffers from a null pointer dereference vulnerability. This
vulnerability exists in its lldp related component. Due to fail to
check if ChassisID TLV is contained in the packet, by sending a
crafted lldp packet to the device, an attacker can crash the process
due to null pointer dereference.

Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/jchristn/IpMatcher

Reference: MISC:https://github.com/kaoudis/advisories/blob/main/0-2021.md

An Input Validation Vulnerability exists in Joel Christner .NET C#
packages WatsonWebserver, IpMatcher 1.0.4.1 and below (IpMatcher) and
4.1.3 and below (WatsonWebserver) due to insufficient validation of
input IP addresses and netmasks against the internal Matcher list of
IP addresses and subnets.

Name: CVE-2021-33321

and Liferay DXP before 7.3, allows remote attackers to enumerate user

Name: CVE-2021-33322
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://issues.liferay.com/browse/LPE-16981

pack 96, 7.1 before fix pack 18, and 7.2 before fix pack 5, password
reset tokens are not invalidated after a user changes their password,

Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://community.opmantek.com/display/OA/Errata+-+4.0.1+XSS+in+SQL+debugging+output

Opmantek Open-AudIT 4.0.1 is affected by cross-site scripting (XSS).
When outputting SQL statements for debugging, a maliciously crafted
query can trigger an XSS attack. This attack only succeeds if the user
is already logged in to Open-AudIT before they click the malicious
link.

Name: CVE-2021-33334

Reference: CONFIRM:https://portal.liferay.dev/learn/security/known-vulnerabilities/-/asset_publisher/HbL5mxmVrnXW/content/id/120748332

The Dynamic Data Mapping module in Liferay Portal 7.0.0 through 7.3.2,
and Liferay DXP 7.0 before fix pack 94, 7.1 before fix pack 19, and
7.2 before fix pack 6, does not properly check user permissions, which
allows remote attackers with the forms "Access in Site Administration"
permission to view all forms and form entries in a site via the forms
section in site administration.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33335
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://issues.liferay.com/browse/LPE-17103
Reference: CONFIRM:https://portal.liferay.dev/learn/security/known-vulnerabilities/-/asset_publisher/HbL5mxmVrnXW/content/id/120747906

Privilege escalation vulnerability in Liferay Portal 7.0.3 through
7.3.4, and Liferay DXP 7.1 before fix pack 20, and 7.2 before fix pack
9 allows remote authenticated users with permission to update/edit
users to take over a company administrator user account by editing the
company administrator user.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33336
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://issues.liferay.com/browse/LPE-17078
Reference: CONFIRM:https://portal.liferay.dev/learn/security/known-vulnerabilities/-/asset_publisher/HbL5mxmVrnXW/content/cve-2021-33336-stored-xss-with-structure-name

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Journal module's add
article menu in Liferay Portal 7.3.0 through 7.3.3, and Liferay DXP
7.1 fix pack 18, and 7.2 fix pack 5 through 7, allows remote attackers
to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the
_com_liferay_journal_web_portlet_JournalPortlet_name parameter.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33337
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://issues.liferay.com/browse/LPE-17101
Reference: CONFIRM:https://portal.liferay.dev/learn/security/known-vulnerabilities/-/asset_publisher/HbL5mxmVrnXW/content/cve-2021-33337-stored-xss-with-document-types-in-documents-and-media

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Document Library
module's add document menu in Liferay Portal 7.3.0 through 7.3.4, and
Liferay DXP 7.1 before fix pack 20, and 7.2 before fix pack 9, allows
remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the
_com_liferay_document_library_web_portlet_DLAdminPortlet_name
parameter.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33338
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://issues.liferay.com/browse/LPE-17030
Reference: CONFIRM:https://portal.liferay.dev/learn/security/known-vulnerabilities/-/asset_publisher/HbL5mxmVrnXW/content/id/120748276

The Layout module in Liferay Portal 7.1.0 through 7.3.2, and Liferay
DXP 7.1 before fix pack 19, and 7.2 before fix pack 6, exposes the
CSRF token in URLs, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain
the token and conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks via
the p_auth parameter.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33339
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://issues.liferay.com/browse/LPE-17102
Reference: CONFIRM:https://portal.liferay.dev/learn/security/known-vulnerabilities/-/asset_publisher/HbL5mxmVrnXW/content/id/120747934

Liferay Portal 7.2.1 through 7.3.4, and Liferay DXP 7.2 before fix
pack 9 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML
via the _com_liferay_site_admin_web_portlet_SiteAdminPortlet_name
parameter.

could allow an authenticated remote attacker to inject arbitrary

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33357
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/omriinbar/52c000c02a6992c6ce68d531195f69cf
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/RaspAP/raspap-webgui/blob/master/ajax/networking/get_netcfg.php

A vulnerability exists in RaspAP 2.6 to 2.6.5 in the "iface" GET
parameter in /ajax/networking/get_netcfg.php, when the "iface"
parameter value contains special characters such as ";" which enables
an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary OS commands.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33358
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/omriinbar/52c000c02a6992c6ce68d531195f69cf
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/RaspAP/raspap-webgui/blob/8f0ae3b36aa1020d21477e66010c6b2146e7c222/app/img/wifi-qr-code.php
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/RaspAP/raspap-webgui/blob/b02660d5ff8d9faa5d3ef49778b23e832851e0f4/includes/hostapd.php

Multiple vulnerabilities exist in RaspAP 2.3 to 2.6.5 in the
"interface", "ssid" and "wpa_passphrase" POST parameters in /hostapd,
when the parameter values contain special characters such as ";" or
"$()" which enables an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary OS
commands.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33359
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/sensepost/gowitness/releases/tag/2.3.6
Reference: MISC:https://twitter.com/leonjza/status/1395283512433971202?s=19

A vulnerability exists in gowitness < 2.3.6 that allows an
unauthenticated attacker to perform an arbitrary file read using the
file:// scheme in the url parameter to get an image of any file.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-3336
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.wolfssl.com/docs/security-vulnerabilities
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/wolfSSL/wolfssl/pull/3676

DoTls13CertificateVerify in tls13.c in wolfSSL before 4.7.0 does not
cease processing for certain anomalous peer behavior (sending an
ED22519, ED448, ECC, or RSA signature without the corresponding
certificate). The client side is affected because man-in-the-middle
attackers can impersonate TLS 1.3 servers.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2021-33360
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://advisory.checkmarx.net/advisory/CX-2021-4811/

An issue found in Stoqey gnuplot v.0.0.3 and earlier allows attackers
to execute arbitrary code via the src/index.ts, plotCallack,
child_process, and/or filePath parameter(s).
